articles.title: Celebrations to mark foundation day of Korean Children's Union
Kim Jong Il's works disseminated in S. Korea
articles.content:
Celebrations to mark foundation day of Korean Children's Union
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- An admission ceremony of the Children's Union for commemorating the 52nd anniversary of the Korean Children's Union was held before the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill on June 6.
  The participants in the ceremony laid floral baskets before the President's Statue and made respects in humble reverence.
    At the ceremony, children made an admission oath and cadres,  anti-Japanese revolutionary veterans, Korean war veterans and men of distinguished services put red ties around their necks and pinned the children's union badges on their breasts.
    Among those present were Kim Jung Rin, Secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Ri Il Hwan, first secretary of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League central committee.
   On the same day, schoolchildren across the country held meetings of the children's union, admission ceremonies of the children's union and sports and amusement games.

articles.title: Month of int'l solidarity with Korean people opens
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's works disseminated in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Famous works of General Kim Jong Il were widely disseminated in South Korea, according to Seoul-based radio voice of national salvation quoting information of the Pusan city committee of the National Democratic Front of South Korea.
   His works "Let us carry out the great leader comrade Kim Il Sung's instructions for national reunification" and "Let us reunify the country independently and peacefully through the great unity of the entire nation" were carried in the literature which was spread under the titles "immortal creed for reunification" and "library of great national unity" from early May.

articles.title: S. Korean puppets' suppression of labour movement denounced
articles.content:
Month of int'l solidarity with Korean people opens
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- An opening ceremony of a  month of international solidarity with the Korean people from June 25 to July 27 was held in Vienna on May 30.
   The chairman of the preparatory committee said in his speech that the U.S.  have illegally occupied South Korea for over half a century and blocked Korea's reunification instead of drawing lessons from their disgraceful defeat in the Korean war. 
   He said that under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army, the Korean people make a long drive in their struggle for socialism in defiance of fierce confrontation with the U.S.-led reactionaries of the world. 
   To further strengthen solidarity with the Korean people is the invariable will of the communist party of Austria and the progressive people, he added.
   A resolution adopted at the ceremony extended full support to the Korean people's struggle to force the U.S. troops blocking the peaceful development of the Korean peninsula out of South Korea at an early date and put an end to Korea's division.

articles.title: Japan hit for its fiction of "suspected abduction"
articles.content:
S. Korean puppets' suppression of labour movement denounced
Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Workers and farmers met in Phyongsong, Sariwon and Nampho to denounce the South Korean puppet clique for suppressing labour movement.
   The general strike of South Korean workers can not be "illegal" in any case, the meetings said, and urged the South Korean puppets to stop at once crackdown upon just struggle of workers.
   The participants said that they have stood on the side of South Korean workers since they launched a strike, and extended full support to them again.
   The meetings called upon South Korean peasants and students and other people to take an active part in the workers' struggle to smash the anti-social labour policy of the puppet clique in firm unity with them.
